equal.description: Adds to the rate of Army Tradition gained each year.
Adds to the decay rate of Army Tradition.
Modifies the Army Tradition bonus when gained through battles.
Modifies the rate of Army Professionalism gained each year.
Modifies the army drill gains while drilling
Modifies the army drill decay rate per year.
Modifies the base cost of infantry units.
Modifies the power infantry gain from unit pips.

Modifies the power cavalry gain from unit pips.
Modifies the base cost of artillery units.
Modifies the power artillery gain from unit pips.
Adds to the ratio required to negate the Insufficient Support penalty.
Modifies the effectiveness of cavalry flanking.
Adds to the bonus artillery get versus forts.
Modifies the bonus damage artillery inflict when in the backrow during combat.
Modifies the discipline of land units.
Modifies the discipline of mercenary units.
Modifies the land morale of land units.
Modifies the siege defensiveness that affects siege phase length.
Modifies the siege ability that affects siege phase length. Reverse concept of defensiveness.
Modifies the base movement speed for all land units.
Modifies the fire damage done by land units.
Modifies the fire damage taken by land units.
Modifies the shock damage done by land units.
Modifies the shock damage taken by land units.
Modifies the army morale recovery speed.
Modifies the bonus siege status by blockaded.
Modifies the morale damage taken by units in reserves (i.e. not in battle, but engaged with another unit)
Modifies the attrition taken by land units.
Modifies the cost of reinforcements when units are reinforced.
Modifies the rate at which units are reinforced with new men.
Modifies the rate at which manpower is recovered.
Adds to the country's total manpower pool. 1 equals 1000 men.
Modifies a country's total manpower pool.
Modifies the base unit cost for all land units.
Modifies the base speed at which land units are recruited.
Modifies the supply limit of provinces
Adds to a country's force limit.
Modifies a country's force limit.
Modifies the maintenance cost of all land units.

Modifies the base condottieri limit.
Modifies the base mercenary limit.

Modifies the base garrison growth in provinces.
Modifies the base fort maintenance cost.
Modifies the base fort maintenance cost for forts in provinces that border rivals.

Adds to the minimum siege pip count a leader can be generated with.

Modifies the amount of loot taken at once during looting.
Modifies the prestige bonus from combat.
Modifies the maximum amount of banners available.
Modifies the military power cost for raising war taxes.
Modifies the military power cost for hiring leaders.

Modifies the naval maintenance for all ships.

Modifies a country's maximum sailor pool.

Modifies the maximum naval engagement width.

Modifies the naval morale of all ships.

Modifies the morale damage taken during battle by losing ships.
Modifies the morale recovery rate of ships.
Modifies the prestige gained through naval battles.
Adds to the minimum fire pip count a leader can be generated with.
Adds to the minimum manuever pip count a leader can be generated with.
Adds to the minimum shock pip count a leader can be generated with.
Modifies the combat bonus navies gain when sailing in coastal tiles that border their home nation.
Adds to a country's diplomat count.
Adds to a country's diplomatic reputation.
Adds to the maximum number of free diplomatic relations.
Modifies diplomat travel time during actions.
Modifies spy network cost for fabricating claim.
Modifies the speed of the Improve Relations diplomatic action.
Modifies the bonus to a country's forcelimit from their subjects.
Modifies the bonus to a country's income from their subjects.
Modifies the total size of Aggressive Expansion gained during actions that confer it.
Modifies the duration of claims.
Modifies the diplomatic power cost for annexation.
Modifies the warscore cost for taking provinces.
Modifies the weighting of demands in peace treaties.
Modifies the cost of coring provinces for enemies that have your cores.
Modifies the diplomatic power cost to change rivals.
Modifies the spy network cost to justify trade conflicts.
Adds to the base tax income per year (i.e. 12 equals 1 extra per month).
Modifies the base tax income by a percentage.
Modifies the base production income by a percentage.
Modifies the maintenance cost for states.
Modifies the administrative power cost for reducing inflation.
Adds to the base yearly inflation rate.
Adds to the base interest rate.
Modifies the development cost for provinces.
Modifies all building costs.
Modifies all building construction times.
Modifies the base core creation cost, diplo-annexation costs and the impact of province development on overextension and warscore cost.
Modifies the base core creation cost.
Modifies the rate at which the cores of a country will decay when under the ownership of a different country.
Modifies the monarch power cost of Administrative technologies. Generated automatically for all technology tables in .
Modifies the monarch power cost of Diplomatic technologies. Generated automatically for all technology tables in .
Modifies the monarch power cost of Military technologies. Generated automatically for all technology tables in .
Modifies the monarch power  cost of all technologies.
Modifies the monarch power cost of purchasable ideas.
Modifies the ducat cost for embracing an institution.
Modifies the rate of spread for institutions in all owned provinces.
Modifies the rate of spread for institutions in owned provinces following the owner's religion.
Modifies the monarch power cost of native advancements.
Modifies the monarch power cost of '''every''' action that costs monarch power.
Modifies the amount of Innovativeness gained
Modifies the amount of free Administrative policies.
Modifies the amount of free Diplomatic policies.
Modifies the amount of free Military policies.
Modifies the amount of Administrative policy slots.

Modifies the amount of policy slots.
Adds to the base yearly rate of prestige.
Adds to the base rate of prestige decay.
Adds to the monthly rate of splendor points.
Adds to the yearly rate of corruption.
Modifies the base cost of advisors.
Adds to the pool size for advisors.
Modifies the base chance rate for female advisors.
Modifies the base chance for an heir during the heir generation tick.
Adds to the base ADM skill a ruler, heir and consort can be generated with.
Adds to the base DIP skill a ruler, heir and consort can be generated with.
Adds to the base MIL skill a ruler, heir and consort can be generated with.
Modifies the cost of hiring an Administrative advisor.
Modifies the cost of hiring an Diplomatic advisor.
Modifies the cost of hiring an Military advisor.
Adds to the yearly base rate of absolutism.
Adds to the maximum value of absolutism. Internally absolutism bonuses do not scale above 100.
Adds to the maximum number of states a country can support.
Adds to the yearly rate of legitimacy.Does not appear or have an effect if a country's government does not use legitimacy.
Adds to the yearly rate of republican tradition.Does not appear or have an effect if a country's government does not use republican tradition.
Adds to the yearly rate of devotion.Does not appear or have an effect if a country's government does not use devotion.
Adds to the yearly rate of horde unity.Does not appear or have an effect if a country's government does not use horde unity.
Adds to the yearly rate of meritocracy. Does not appear or have an effect if a country's government does not use meritocracy.
Adds to the monthly rate of militarisation for governments with the militarisation mechanic.
Adds to the yearly rate of tribal allegiance for governments with the tribal allegiance mechanic.
Modifies the impact of Imperial Authority gains.
Adds to the rate of Imperial Authority gained per month.
Adds to the rate of Mandate gained per month.
Adds to the duration of an election cycle for the current nation. Negative values shorten the duration, positive values add to it.
Adds to the randomized stats a republican candidate may receive during elections.
Modifies the cost in Republican Tradition when re-electing candidates.
Adds to the rate of government reform progress gain.
Modifies the diplomatic power cost for culture conversion in provinces.
Adds to the maximum number of accepted cultures a country can have.
Modifies the advisor cost for advisors that share the same culture as the country's court they're in.
Modifies the diplomatic power cost for promoting a culture.
Adds to the base unrest value.
Modifies the administrative power cost of raising stability.
Adds to the monthly rate of autonomy in owned provinces.
Sets the minimum autonomy level allowed in all owned provinces.
Modifies the cooldown for the autonomy reduction and increase buttons.
Modifies the military power cost for using harsh treatment.
Adds to the base separatism value of provinces when conquered.
Modifies the minimum autonomy experienced in territories.
Adds to subject liberty desire against their overlord.
Adds to the subject liberty desire from development against their overlord.
Adds to the liberty desire subjects have against their overlord. Applied to the overlord.
Adds to the liberty desire subjects have against their overlord if on the same continent. Applied to the overlord.
Modifies the base effectiveness of spies against enemies.
Modifies the base effectiveness of counter-espionage against enemy spies.
Modifies the relations impact applied to a country when discovered committing an espionage action.
Modifies the effectiveness of supported rebels in other countries.
Adds to the base missionary strength against all religions.
Adds to the base missionary strength against heretic religions.
Adds to the base missionary count for a country.
Adds to the base religious unity value for a country.
Adds to the base tolerance for the true faith within a country.
Adds to the base tolerance for heretics within a country.
Adds to the base tolerance for heathens within a country.
Adds to the rate of papal influence gained per year.
Modifies the effectiveness of church power gains.
Adds to the rate of fervor gained per month.
Modifies the rate at which harmonization occurs.
Adds to the rate of harmony gained per year.
Adds to the rate of piety gained per month.
Adds to the rate of karma gained per month.
Modifies the war score cost for the Enforce Religion peace term.
Adds to the prestige bonus gained per development when successfully converting a province to a state religion.
Modifies the war score costs for peace terms whilst in war against countries of a different religion.
Modifies the base colonist count for a country.
Adds to the base colonial placement chance for colonists, which is the chance that additional settlers will be spawned whilst the colonist is present.
Adds to the base yearly colonial growth gain.
Modifies the base colonisation  used for exploration, colonisation and coring province that border sea.
Adds to the chance of native uprisings in a colony province.
Modifies the bonus from assimilation in colonies. Native assimilation is bonus to goods produced depends on the native population.
Modifies the cooldown for the migration action for primitive nations that can migrate.
Modifies the tariff income from colonial nations.
Modifies the bonus trade power inland nodes receive from trade power sources.
Adds to the base merchant count for a country.
Modifies the additional trade power when a merchant present in a trade node.
Modifies the trade power in all trade nodes for a country.
Modifies the trade power for a country in trade nodes that are not [[Trade#Domestic_trade_powerdomestic]].
Modifies the trade power for a country in trade nodes that are [[Trade#Domestic_trade_powerdomestic]].
Modifies the base trade power of owned provinces.
Modifies the base trade good size of owned provinces.
Modifies a country's trade income. (Maximum is 200%)
Modifies the trade range used to determine if a country can place a merchant in a trade node.
Modifies the bonus to trade power used for steering when determining which outgoing node trade is steered to. If you have a merchant present, it also slightly increases the outgoing value.
Modifies the trade power ships grant when protecting trade.
Modifies the effectiveness of privateers in a trade node.
Modifies the effectiveness of embargoing another country.
Modifies the propagation of trade power from ships protecting trade.
Adds to the maximum attrition that can be experienced in a province.
Adds to the base attrition in a province.
Adds to the base attrition for enemies in a province.
Adds to the fort level in a province, determining how difficult it is to siege.
Modifies the rate of garrison growth in a province.
Modifies the defensiveness of a province, impacting siege phase length.
Modifies the movement speed of units in a province that are considered friendly.
Modifies the movement speed of units in a province that are considered enemies.
Adds to the base manpower value. 1 equals 1000 men.
Modifies the manpower efficiency in a province.
Modifies the recruitment cost of land units in a province.
Modifies the recruitment speed of land units in a province.
Adds to the base supply limit of a province.
Modifies the supply limit efficiency of a province.
Modiifes the amount of banners that can be raised from a province.
Modifies the naval engagement width in a province. Only usable in sea provinces.
Adds to the sailors value for a province. 1 equals 1 sailor.
Modifies the sailors efficiency of a province.
Modifies the cost of ship recruitment in a province.
Modifies the speed of ship repair in a province.
Modifies the recruitment speed of ships in a province.
Adds to the colonial growth in a colony province.
Adds to the placement chance in a colony province.
Adds to the base yearly inflation value. Requires '''every''' province in a country to have the modifier to work however.
Modifies the state maintenance cost for the state that a province belongs to.
Modifies the cost of constructing buildings in a province.
Modifies the construction speed of buildings in a province.
Adds to the devastation rate in a province.
Modifies the production efficiency in a province.
Modifies the tax efficiency in a province.
Adds to the yearly tax income of a province.
Adds to the maximum number of building slots in a province.
Modifies the monarch power cost for development in a province. Converts to local_tax_modifier in for non-Common Sense owners.
Modifies the spread of institutions in a province.
Modifies the cost of coring in a province.
Modifies the monarch power cost for development in a province. Does not appear or affect non-Common Sense owners.
Modifies the trade power efficiency in a province.
Adds to the trade power in a province.
Modifies the goods produced efficiency in a province.
Adds to the trade good size in a province
Modifies the base trade value in a province.
Adds to the base trade value in a province.
Adds to the missionary strength in a province. 1 equals 100% strength.
Adds to conversion resistance from Centres of Reformation.
Modifies the culture conversion cost in a province.
Adds to the unrest value in a province.
Adds to the autonomy rate in a province.
Adds to the base nationalism value in a province.
Sets the minimum autonomy value a province can have.
Grants attack bonus in provinces with the same terrain as capital province.
Allows units to ignore fort zones of control.
Allows claims to be enacted through already claimed provinces.
Grants bonus 1 tax, production and manpower on completed colonies.
Allows usage of the Transfer Subject peace term at half cost.
Allows usage of the force march action for free.
Removes maintenance cost for explorers and conquisadors.
Allows coring in any uncored province, regardless of distance.
Acts a visible script flag. Can be checked in triggers with cb_on_government_enemies = yes
Acts a visible script flag. Can be checked in triggers with cb_on_religious_enemies = yes
Allows claims to be fabricated on overseas provinces in Colonial regions.
Allows claims to be fabricated on overseas provinces in Trade Company regions.
Allows claims to be fabricated on overseas provinces in Colonial regions that are owned by by another nation that is also overseas.
Allows the recruitment of explorers and conquisadors.
Allows ships to perform slave raids.
Allows the recruitment of female generals.
Removes the penalties associated with negative religious tolerance.
Reduces the stability hits when taking diplomatic actions that cause them (i.e. Break Marriage).
Allows ships to repair in coastal sea zones adjacent to owned provinces.
Allows the usage of the Siberean Frontier mechanic.
Grants an increase in manpower recovery by a factor of 3 during religious wars.
Grants the abiliy to automatically discover undiscovered provinces adjacent to colonies.
Allows the usage of Manchu banner units. Country scope.
Allows Manchu banner units to be raised in owned provinces. Province scope.
